TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in the city of GPE . She was represented before the Court by PERSON , a lawyer practicing in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agents , PERSON and PERSON . PERSON , of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE ORG and the former GPE concluded an agreement about the mutual evacuation of NORP population from GPE and NORP population from GPE .
In DATE the applicant ’s family was moved from the ORG region in GPE to the NORP region in GPE .

On DATE , the PERSON of GPE introduced amendments to the LAW “ on the Status of War Veterans and their ORG Guaranties ” of DATE , granting the war participant status to some categories of persons , including those , who were moved to the territory of GPE after DATE from the territories of other states .

On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in the ORG against the local social welfare department , challenging the refusal of the latter to grant her the status of war participant in accordance with LAW on the Status of War Veterans and their ORG Guaranties ” .

On DATE the court rejected the applicant ’s claim . The court found that she met CARDINAL of the conditions under the said PERSON , namely that she had been moved to the territory of GPE after DATE . However , being born in DATE , she did not fulfil the further requirement that persons , who were born after DATE , had to prove the fact of their work during the war .

On DATE ORG upheld the decision of the first instance court , having established that the first - instance court applied the relevant law correctly . On DATE the applicant posted her cassation appeal , which was received by the court on DATE .

On DATE the ORG rejected the applicant ’s request for a cassation appeal as having been submitted too late . The court stated that , under the new wording of LAW ( hereinafter - “ the ORG ” ) , which had entered into force on DATE , the time - limit for lodging an appeal in cassation was DATE , and that the applicant had exceeded that time - limit by only submitting her appeal on DATE .
The applicant appealed against this decision , stating that she posted her cassation appeal on DATE and this date should be considered as date of lodging of her appeal .
On DATE ORG upheld the ruling of CARDINAL DATE , stating that the applicant had lodged her appeal on DATE , which had been outside the new DATE time - limit established by law .
On DATE the panel of CARDINAL judges of ORG rejected the applicant ’s request for leave to appeal in cassation against the rulings of DATE and DATE .

At the time of the second instance appellate decision , the first paragraph of LAW ORG provided that a cassation appeal should be lodged within DATE of the appellate decision or within DATE of the decision of the first instance court , if the latter decision was not appealed under the normal appellate procedure .

On DATE ORG passed a law amending the ORG ( hereinafter DATE “ LAW ) , including the LAW in question . It came into force on DATE . The new wording of Article CARDINAL created a DATE time - limit for lodging a cassation application against the decision of an appellate court .
The PERSON provides for different social benefits to the war veterans , war participants , and other categories of persons touched by the Second World War .

LAW , in its wording of DATE , provided a wide range of social benefits for the war participants , including free medical services and free use of public transport , reduction of fees , priority in obtaining some other social benefits , etc . The persons entitled to the war participant status were listed in LAW , which read in so far as relevant :
“ The following persons shall be considered the war participants :
... CARDINAL ) persons , who worked ... during the Great Patriotic War ...
... persons who were resettled after DATE to the territory of GPE from the territory of other states ... shall also be considered as war participants ...

... For persons , who were born after DATE , the status of war participant can be established only in presence of documents and other evidence that unequivocally prove the fact of their work during the war ... ”

Both parties submitted a number of decisions of the first - instance and regional courts in cases similar to CARDINAL of the applicant . These decisions demonstrate discrepancy in the application of the above quoted paragraph CARDINAL of LAW . Some of the courts considered that the fact of resettlement is an autonomous requirement to obtain the war participant status , some others read it , like in the applicant ’s case , in conjunction with the requirement of proving the fact of work , if the person concerned was born after DATE .
Such ambiguity was eliminated by LAW DATE , when the repatriates were listed separately in a new paragraph CARDINAL of Article CARDINAL , which read as follows :
“ ... CARDINAL ) persons who were resettled after DATE to the territory of GPE from the territory of other states . ”
